website_summaries.verdict: Even though this unit can also be used as a pressure cooker,  this unit functions best as a canner and should last for many years of use.
pros: Made of durable, heavy-gauge aluminum that's built to last
Includes a useful flat steamer rack
cons: Cannot be used on magnetic induction stove tops

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Work on Glass Top Stoves!!!
customer_reviews.text: The description does not tell you that it doesn't work on glass top stoves. I only found out when the canner arrived. There were no instructions in the box. The info about glass top stoves is on the box.
customer_reviews.author: S Craft

customer_reviews.title: Correct Description
customer_reviews.text: The description of the Mirro pressure canner 92116, stated that it would hold 5 quart jars. In fact it holds 7 quarts and is much larger than expected and wanted. I have a 7 quart canner and wanted a smaller one for easier loading and lifting. Also, it came with a recipe booklet, but no instructions on how to use it. I usually don't have any problems with ordering from Amazon, but this time was very disappointed in the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Canner_Excellent price
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th pressure cooker. It is my 3rd canner. I also have a water Bath Canner. Of them all, this one is the most useful because it will can 18 regular and 16 wide mouth jars OR 7 quarts. I cannot afford a couple hundred dollars for one of those Fort Knox looking type. This simple to use canner is efficient and safe. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: hombre243Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Gonna give this canner away if anyone will take it
customer_reviews.text: As busy as I've been in my garden, I failed to return this product within the acceptable period; however, I want to state some facts about it. I only used it once in canning green beans. I added the vinegar to avoid staining the interior as suggested in the user guide; however, a stain about an inch wide near the bottom plus streaks down the sides happened during that first and only use. Mere soap and water does not remove them. I particularly do not like the pressure control "jiggler" and the way it operates. I will no longer buy any Mirror products.
customer_reviews.author: Ann@Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Saftey hazard faulty item.
customer_reviews.text: Hi I've only used this product one time and only for about 2 hours to jar some veggies and the bottom of the pressure cooker seems to have bulged outward , sort of like the safety seal on a Snapple bottle when you open the lid .. the circular bottom sort of bulged out . I'm scared to use it again and am not sure if it was always like that or if it's a saftey issue that just started to appear ... I'm sure the bottom should sit flat and. Not have a rounded bottom to it , I would like a replacement of this item as I have only used it once..
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It's very hard as a newbie to get the pressure right, but cool when you do. I recommend marking the stove dial with a Sharpie to remember where that magic setting lies for your burner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and it is very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pressure canner several times now, and it is very easy to use. The big thing is following all the directions before and after you start to can. I am very happy with my selection.
customer_reviews.author: Fern R. Biesecker

customer_reviews.title: No customer service available - buy a Presto instead
customer_reviews.text: The canner does its job, but the lid cracked while canning yesterday. I have used it only 4 times. I called the phone number listed in the manual for warranty claims, and was greeted by a pre-recorded voice that said the phones were not being answered and to "go to our website." No company was named except for "consumer services" being mentioned at the beginning of the call. The website listed in the manual does not load. The customer service email that I found is no longer in use. If you expect any kind of customer service for this product, don't buy it. Get a Presto instead.
customer_reviews.author: time4trouble

customer_reviews.title: WILL NOT WORK ON GLASS COOKTOP!!!Amazon does not tell you in the ad!
customer_reviews.text: THIS ITEM WILL NOT WORK ON A GLASSTOP STOVE! Amazon should place this warning in the ad. I just wasted two weeks waiting for this product bought all my corn beef 20 pounds! And now this thing won’t work on a glass cooktop. I’m very upset. Let’s see if they’ll send me a return shipping slip which was $23 to ship. Be careful, Amazon will no longer take your calls, and basically is trying everything in their power to not give refunds. Demand justice!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Not Working !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to get this canner to work for many months. I went by their instructions provided in the manual and then, went on line. No matter what I try, I cannot get the piece to jiggle after bringing to boil. With it on to start or to add it later, once steam vents from the side. I love Mirro products, so I had high hopes for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle Kilmury

customer_reviews.title: The customer service is so bad, that when I called to ask a question ...
customer_reviews.text: The cooker will not jiggle I have it loaded with green beans water was coming from the weight but it did not move, after it vented for ten minutes with a continuous stream of steam, I i put 10 pounds of weight and nothing happen steam was coming from the handle and that was it. I turn the stove off because the book stated that to know it was working correctly would mean the jiggle was rocking at a steady pace it did not. The customer service is so bad, that when I called to ask a question she made it seem as if I was an in convenience to her day they really suck!!!
customer_reviews.author: justme598

customer_reviews.title: Great pressure canner!
customer_reviews.text: I was new to pressure canning. I loved my new canner!! I was able to put up a lot of food for my family. It’s easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Happy1345

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality and failed. Not so safe methinks
customer_reviews.text: I loved the fact that there was so much space in this cooker. And two racks to boot. I can a lot and I clean my equipment well. I used this Mirro for 2 years canning 24 jars at 15 psi maybe 5 times total in this pot without issue. But... you only need one issue like I had with this pressure cooker to decide to dump it and warn youse all to buy something of better quality. The bottom totally bulged out and warped last time I used it. It did not hit 15psi the safety valve did not pop and the whole thing almost blew. Got to agree with other reviews, not so safe!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Pamboukes

customer_reviews.title: So happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: after years of borrowing my mom's mirro presssure canner I decided to buy my own. I decided to stay with the same brand as hers because it worked so well and has canned a lot of fish over the years. I did decide to go with the Bigger size just to cut down on time and I am so glad i did. This canner is huge and It works perfectly. I highly recommend this canner to anyone that needs one. I love it so much I am thinking about getting a couple more to give away as gifts. I would give it 10 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Shelikestofish

customer_reviews.title: Great canner for anyone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I didn’t trust the electronic pressure gauges and preferred the shakers. I was a beginning canner when I bought, but I’m still using it a few years later. It scared the crap out of me the first time I used it and it started shaking, but now I know that’s normal. It is bulky and hard to store/clean, but you can can a lot in it.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Good large pressure cooker!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a large pressure cooker with short handles, and finally found this 16 qt one that fits my needs perfectly. I have smaller ones 6 & 8 quart with the long handle closure and really don’t like that style. I wont be using it for canning, but have used it many times to cook large quantities of meat and it works just fine. Quality seems very good too.
customer_reviews.author: Pali

customer_reviews.title: Great pressure cooker  . Multiple safety features that make it safer are nice to have
customer_reviews.text: Great for canning and for cooking . Great size and has two racks for canning with it and variable pressure for 5 , 10 , 15 psi . Great and easy to use . It is large so it takes a while to heat up but this is worth it for canning in bulk .
customer_reviews.author: select few

customer_reviews.title: Great cooker!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this now for a few months to make many pints of canned food. I love it! It's easy to use, and simple to operate. At my elevation, 8,000 feet, I only use the 15 lb weight for it. I can set it and go do other things around the house while I listen for the steam making the weight dance. I do NOT have to go back into the kitchen to monitor a gauge every few minutes. Using the clear instructions that came with it I've been able to can lots of food, including elk meat, for long term storage. I think I will be using this cooker for many many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but it does its job. Can't stack quart size jars in it though
customer_reviews.text: It makes a LOT of noise while canning, which I guess is fair. Something that was disappointing is that I can just barely not stack quart-size jars in it (it's too short). I *can* just barely stack pint size jars on top of quart size ones, though, so hopefully I can make up for lost efficiency that way.
customer_reviews.author: Sourec

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a beginner. Helpfull hint after it vents and go to put on the weights make sure you hear to clicks. He needs to be firmly pushed on. I thought 1 click was enough and waited almost an hour for it to jiggle. After some research I realized it needed to be firmly pushed into place.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pressure cooker/canner in 2012 and use it on a regular basis. I have not yet needed to replace the silicon seal and it still works great. It is primarily used to make bone broth and then can it. I am contemplating purchasing a second one since the price is much lower now.
customer_reviews.author: T. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product for families to have ,just in case you have a large family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The product has changed but the manual has not been ...
customer_reviews.text: The product has changed but the manual has not been updated. The manual is "WRONG." The pressure gauge on the older ones jiggled when the proper pressure was reached -- as the manual states. The newer model does not. You have to watch the pressure gauge to make sure it "puffs" 3 to 4 times per minute. If I had known this I would not have purchased it. On the older model I did not have to stay in the kitchen and count puffs. I could do something and just listen for the jiggle. I am going to return it.
customer_reviews.author: momcat

customer_reviews.title: Even my mom likes it
customer_reviews.text: I love it! I brought for my mom because she wanted a new one. We wanted a way to make healthy soups and meals- this was great! I'm enjoying homemade foods canned this summer in minutes now that fall is here! My 76- year mom does have problems when she attempts to snap the lid in place but she's weak. (Sorry mom!) So that is my job! I really like it and so does mom. The directions were easy. My only compliant is I have a glass top stove and pressure cookers don't work on them so I go to my sisters or moms house.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Beware the "non-jiggling" jiggler
customer_reviews.text: Pressure cooker/canner works fine, but be advised. The "jiggler' does not work as expected. About every minute or so, the jiggler twirls around in a partial circle, that is the extent of the "jiggling". If you are new to pressure canning, this will throw you off as you will wait a lifetime for the rocking/jiggling motion to begin. Never happens. Other than that, the unit worked just fine
customer_reviews.author: kaydaynow

customer_reviews.title: Nice canner
customer_reviews.text: Love these canners. I have 2 of these and a Presto. I like these better. Simple, safe, idiot proof and do their job. The Presto I always have problems with the gaskets not wanting to seal. Even after replacing them, they only last a few times. I also have noticed the Presto has bowed on the bottom and no longer sits level on the burners. No problems with these Mirror canners.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: bad experience
customer_reviews.text: tested the cooker all day, i don't think it is any good, could not get any pressure and the steam comes out the handle. i don't think this is correctly venting ..
customer_reviews.author: Whimcycle

customer_reviews.title: Not Sure What's Wrong
customer_reviews.text: The lid was scratched up and I wasn't able to get the pot shaking on my gas stove at high heat for almost 2 hours. Steam came out by the handle and the valve popped up at one point, but it didn't look like the videos. I think I got a pot that had been returned by another customer. I wish I kept the packaging... it would be going back!
customer_reviews.author: LynnKS

customer_reviews.title: Great value, except the bowing.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had several of these now, and they are a great value, but the bottoms tend to bow out after a few uses. They need to address this and it would be an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: DonutDrRon

customer_reviews.title: Its Godzilla big on a stove
customer_reviews.text: Silicate does adhere to the bottom but it works great for sterilization, which is what I use it for. It can hold 4 1/2 gallon jars or more than several quart jars. I love it
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Dicicco

customer_reviews.title: Great product after 3 tries getting it
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this canner and when it came from amazon (smiley box) it had a broken handle. I sent it back and second one cam from another company. It also had a broken handle. Sent it back and the third one cam and finnally wasn't broken YEAH! I have used it and it does a wonderful Job. I love that it does not have the pressure gauge that has to be watched.I went in the living room and as long as I heard the jiggling every so often I knew it was ok. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: The price is right, the finish is not!
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Finish is easy to scratch. Gotta handle very gentle. Even though I use cream of tartar as it recommends, I still get stains on the inside from canning. Although I find complaints, I wouldn't buy a different brand. This one is very safe and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Minor issue
customer_reviews.text: It is a very nice size, but had trouble with the gasket. It doesn't always seal well, it seems bigger than it should be.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Can Do Canner!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I have used it for canning venison and homemade dog food for my spoiled pet. I also have plans for canning other meats when on sale. If you have used a weighted pressure cooker you will be able to start out of the box. If new to pressure canning there is a little bit of a learning curve but nothing that should intimidate you. It WILL hold 7 Wide Mouth Quarts or 16 Wide Mouth Pints (using the stacking tray) with no problem. I like how its tall profile fits the top of my gas stovetop. I ordered a second one for a gift for son who also cans.
customer_reviews.author: JMD

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the product.. used to prepare chicken biryani for a family get together and came out amazing.. serves up to 25 people! Huge pressure cooker!
customer_reviews.author: vasu

customer_reviews.title: It came nicely package the weights in a separate box however the ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it a lot, canning for the first time. I still have a little trouble putting the lid on and off. you have to pull up on both handles at the same time and turn. It is harder then it sounds. It came nicely package the weights in a separate box however the instruction manual was missing. A first time caner needs an instruction manual. I enjoy canning, I didn't think I would. The affordability of this gave me the opportunity to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Just as described/ works just fine
customer_reviews.text: I like the size. Lid goes on with ease. Would buy again. Canned many jars already!

customer_reviews.title: Mirror Pressure Canner
customer_reviews.text: Used them for years and time to upgrade. Could not can without it.
customer_reviews.author: Vada Keller

customer_reviews.title: liked so much i came back for another one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these a few weeks ago. New to canning and wanted to put up some soup. instructions are a little lacking, but plenty of blogs and info on you tube about the weight and the lack of constant jiggle. My experience was the "jiggle" was more of a release of excess steam that when up to pressure would occurr every 20 seconds or so. Anyway the soup turned out just fine. I am having so much fun, i just bought another one so i can process as much as possible at one time.
customer_reviews.author: kim hennessey

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product and the price
customer_reviews.text: At first I was a little nervous, to say the least, but after reading the directions and testing out the canner I have come full circle and feel comfortable using it. You must stay close while using this canner, at least, within earshot of the stove so you can hear if its releasing steam correctly. I'm hoping for many years of canning with this canner. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Evans

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with the right instructions. No cook time instructions either. Q
customer_reviews.author: Craig Keysar

customer_reviews.title: I HAVE USED THIS TO TEACH A FRIEND WATER BATH ...
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE USED THIS TO TEACH A FRIEND WATER BATH CANNING. I HAVE YET TO USE MY MIRRO FOR PRESSURE CANNING. BUT, WHEN WE DECIDE WHEN WE WILL DO UP SOME BEANS OR MEATS/FISH, THEN THIS IS THE CANNER TO HAVE. THE WEIGHTED GAUGE AS THIS CANNER IS DOES NOT HAVE TO BE ADJUSTED EVERY YEAR OF USE, THE WAY A DIAL GAUGE CANNER DOES. SOMETHING TO THINK ABOUT.
customer_reviews.author: ekorner

customer_reviews.title: Canner Rack
customer_reviews.text: The manual shows that is should have 2 rack but mine only came with 1. Will update review after using it in next couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L

customer_reviews.title: You should just try this product.
customer_reviews.text: My first time using a pressure canner loving this product. Will be canning everything i can get my hands on.
customer_reviews.author: Vernice Gray

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing. Poorly Designed Handle Locks.
customer_reviews.text: Leaks at the handle. Will not create the vacuum needed. Tried a new seal - no luck. Will be contacting manufacturer as it is too late for me to return thru Amazon. I have a thirty year old Mirro that works like a champ. Sorry to see that the quality has deteriorated so significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good size. But when I use it first time color blacked from inside
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large batches
customer_reviews.text: Works great, seals well. Use this on a large propane burner outside as it is a little large for my stove. Different weights for pressure take the guesswork out. 14 pint jars at a time, 7-8 quart jars. Replacement gaskets available, and parts in case you drop the lid (oops).
customer_reviews.author: Loren

customer_reviews.title: The more water in it the longer it takes to pressurize!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for canning, just have to monitor how much water you put in. I recommend no more than 2 inches of water for two tiers of cans. Perfect quality for the price you pay. Very durable very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nick King

customer_reviews.title: and quality of construction are good, but there is something wrong with the vent ...
customer_reviews.text: The size, and quality of construction are good, but there is something wrong with the vent assembly. Instead of the constant rattle and clatter that you get from a regular pressure cooker weight. This one will rattle and shake for a few seconds, and then sit still for minutes on end before it does it again. Regardless of the burner setting.
customer_reviews.author: Oly

customer_reviews.title: Works As Hot Water Bath Canner!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first year canning from my garden I bought this for green beans, but they didn't produce enough so I haven't used it as a pressure cooker yet. However, I have used it as a hot water bath with much success. It's huge. I love it! I can't wait to use it again next year - hopefully for some green beans!
customer_reviews.author: Heather T

customer_reviews.title: This is terrible for pressure cooking grains
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible for pressure cooking grains, which is the purpose I bought it for. It takes a long time to get to pressure (10-20 minutes or more), and when it does, violent bursts of steam come out and it is confusing how to keep it at pressure. It takes 3 times the time to cook beans in this as with the Presto cooker I have where I can more confidently regulate the pressure. Maybe it works well for canning.
customer_reviews.author: josh robbins

customer_reviews.title: Great for large canning jobs
customer_reviews.text: It will soon be time to visit the farmers' markets across the country, and this is the canner that can kelp you lay up your own no-preservatives-or salt added foods. This is a wonderfully large size that is easy to operate. Remember, to order replacement seals because they only last one canning season (which is typlical). Enjoy the fresh taste all winter long. I highly recommend this canner as it is top quality at a very reasonable price. Doc
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Docwell

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but leaks rust
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work fine, but the pressure gauge leaks rusty water. After 1 use the brand new pretty mirror finish on the lid is ugly and old looking.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you plan on cleaning/sterilizing jars.
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker leaves residue and spots on everything after everything is said and done. If you are into canning avoid this one and go with stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: W. Molnor

customer_reviews.title: super reliable
customer_reviews.text: great unit and works like a charm, just smooth sailing
customer_reviews.author: LiliVale

customer_reviews.title: BEST for home canning.  Buy this over a model that has manual valve and gages
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT for home canning. Don't buy one with a manual dial and gage - those will fail. This is simple you pick the weight to sit on top. The weight determines the amount of pressure you get. There is also mutiple other safety so you can't blow this thing up
customer_reviews.author: JP Vic

customer_reviews.title: This puppy is huge!
customer_reviews.text: Be sure you know the difference between a canner and a pressure cooker, and look carefully at what you want to do. Research your recepies and volume carefully. SOME stoves do NOT have the capacity to heat the water bath canning. ESPecially if you use a glass top stove. You WILL break or damage it using this size. This works well for me. I can a lot of salsa. 16 pint capacity is what sold me on the model. Like the pressure part, a lot shorter processing time and twice the capacity of a regular wather bath canner.
customer_reviews.author: L K Wieland

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Mirro Pressure Cooker I've owned. This replaces the one that is pushing 30 years old. It works as well or better than the old one did when it was new; but has better safety features. I like the new design of the weights; I found it much easier to adjust the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Simons

customer_reviews.title: Mirro is #1
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mirro 4 qt and a Mirro 6 qt pressure cooker that I have used since I got married in 1974. When I decided to get a 16 qt it had to be Mirro. Dependable and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Parmenter

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Very large, great for my big family
customer_reviews.author: jenniferprice_

customer_reviews.title: New model- DOES NOT FIT 2 layers of pints for waterbath canning
customer_reviews.text: FYI: This model, 92122A, is a NEW version of the previous model 92122 (mfg. says it was released in 2011). This version is slightly shorter and wider than the previous model. As a result, it CANNOT accommodate two layers of pint jars for waterbath canning- it is not tall enough to provide the required 1" of water over the top of the jars when packed full. I called the manufacturer to confirm, and as the majority of the canning I do is waterbath (a big pot is a big pot, and who has the room to keep two of this size?), I'll be returning this canner and attempting to locate the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this. I wanted a pressure canner for years but kept hem hawing around about it. This one came highly recommended in several canning groups I am in so I finally bought it. So far it works great and we've done a fair amount of canning with it already.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff & Jon

customer_reviews.title: This big beautiful pot is a great thing to have
customer_reviews.text: This big beautiful pot is a great thing to have. It came with all of the instructions and a couple of recipes. I just need read them. Ha ha. Seriously good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Patyi

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend READING ALL THE DIRECTIONS B E F O R E using the first time. Works as expected. Used twice most of the day both times.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Tater

customer_reviews.title: The rocker leaks rust and stains the lid
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this pressure cooker only to find its difficult to reach 15 psi and the rocker leaks rusty water and stained the lid :( Nothing like brand new cookware that looks old and gross.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Need instructions and recipes included as promised
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn’t come with the referenced instructions and recipes. I found the link to the instruction manual and printed it, but it doesn’t go into helpful detail about canning meat, which hopefully the recipes would have done.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia S. Pennala

customer_reviews.title: I’m an idiot.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be me, an idiot trying to use a hot plate to get this thing to 15psi. It doesn’t work. Gas burner had it up to proper psi in no time at all. Would recommend. Plenty of room inside for whatever you need.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & time saver on cooking
customer_reviews.text: I cook brisket ribs beans ect in this pot much faster than other cooking methods
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great improvement to old mirror pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: just like the old mirror pressure cooker this one is a great unit. nice improvements to the pressure buttons that are used to control the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: J. lee Hern

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I added more water than the minimum recommended but ran out of water. Canning jar rings were burnt as was the bottom of the canner, my meat was dry and the bottom of the canner became warped. Very disappointed in this canner and do not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected. Did arrive with a small blemish on the lid but does not affect the performance.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Shipped on time.
customer_reviews.text: This works just as I expected it to. What can one say, it's a canner. I wanted the weighted for the steam, not the guage one. Just a matter of choice. I've been using it for the past couple of weeks without any issues. I use it to water bath, too. Just don't lock the lid on.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: High quality!
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for canning. It works great! It's easy to clean and holds so many jars so I can make bigger batches of canned goods at a time. Totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Erica A

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't use this on my stove
customer_reviews.text: I gave this away because the bottom was indented and I couldn't use it on my smooth cooktop. Be sure that if you have a smooth cooktop you buy a canner that has a flat bottom and not one that indents.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Mae

customer_reviews.title: Returned ut
customer_reviews.text: Returned because it was too big for glass top stove
customer_reviews.author: katiee

customer_reviews.title: Beginner canners
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. Use as a beginner pot.
customer_reviews.author: sona

customer_reviews.title: Better than I was expecting, honestly.
customer_reviews.text: I read quite a few questionable reviews for this cooker so I was a bit skeptical , but I've used it twice now and love it. Heats to temp pretty quick for it's size. Steam comes from the handle vent at first, until enough pressure builds up and the red indicator on the handle pops up, and the steam leak stops. Rocker spins and lets out a burst of steam a few times a minute. Used at 10psi and 15psi, and am quite happy with both.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Canning Queen
customer_reviews.text: I don't know I waited as long as I did to get one of these. I am super pumped I went with this one instead of another big brand because of all the extras this came with. I foresee the cooker lasting quite some time and now I can finally can safely for my family!
customer_reviews.author: ALuckyLadybugCom

customer_reviews.title: Just learned the fun art of canning and I absolutley loved this cooker
customer_reviews.text: Just learned the fun art of canning and I absolutley loved this cooker. Definitely not your grandmother's cooker! No more fear of the jiggler blowing off. If you have canned forever or just starting out....BUY THIS!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't seal
customer_reviews.text: Would not seal never built up presser ran it for 2 hours and shaker never shook.
customer_reviews.author: amy stanley

customer_reviews.title: but like the use ability of 3 separate sized weights
customer_reviews.text: Have had canner pressure cookers before...but like the use ability of 3 separate sized weights...instead of the stack weights...this is more accurate...have never trusted guages...since over a time it loses it's accuracy...also like use doubling as a water bath unit...
customer_reviews.author: Linny B

customer_reviews.title: 16 Qt Pressure Canner - Mirro
customer_reviews.text: Item is great for canning glass jars. Love that it comes with 5, 10, and 15 psi jigglers - no calibrating required :). Lid is a bit quirky to put on and take off, has to line up just right but not a major issue. I use it on our gas stovetop and have had no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: MED

customer_reviews.title: Great Pressure canner
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to used it many times from canning meats to beans and low acid vegetables
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker does not seal at all. I’ve trouble shooter several times without any success.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best ever .. great price, size,and ease of use.
customer_reviews.text: Wow safety features, can stack pint jars with included 2 aluminum grates. Cleaned up with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: it turn white
customer_reviews.text: its big and roomy but wasn't to happy with it it turn white and look like it was 10 years old on the first time using it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but it arrived quickly and it's very good quality. If you are worried that it's not ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it yet, but it arrived quickly and it's very good quality. If you are worried that it's not a high quality pressure cooker because of the low price, don't be. This is a nice heavy, good quality piece of cookware.
customer_reviews.author: S. Parlogean

customer_reviews.title: very good prchase
customer_reviews.text: Good item and good price. Was the perfect pressure cooker that I can bought. I can cooked more than 25" pasteles" at one time. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: retirada

customer_reviews.title: Does not seal, thus never pressurized.
customer_reviews.text: The seal around the handle leaks, so no pressure ever builds up. Tried all the tricks they suggested, and all the ones that work on my old pressure cookers, but nothing works! Piece of junk! Do not buy! Useless other than just a big pot.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful pressure canner
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful pressure canner, has so many safety features, I didnt realize this when I bought it, I always read product inf but really wasnt aware of all the bells and whistles, really good canner
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Great Pressure Cooker with an amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it a 5, but I have trouble getting the lid closed properly. I am sure it is just me, but you have to have everything lined up just right and I have trouble getting it just right. Other than that it works great when you follow the directions. I love how many jars it holds. I was also pleasantly pleased to find out it had 3 pressure knobs (knowing me it probably said that in the description and I missed it.) I already can't wait until the garden starts growing next spring so we can start canning again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this pressure cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love this pressure cooker. I do a lot of canning and it definitely makes my life easier. I know there are cookers out there with all sorts of new gauges and stuff but I prefer the simplicity of the original weighted pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Angie K

customer_reviews.title: Lousy
customer_reviews.text: Got this as gift. Would not build pressure! Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: susie trapp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this! works great, and love the instruction/recipes, great for beginner!
customer_reviews.author: jean b

customer_reviews.title: The best canners ever only ones I use.
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed using my canner putting up my beans. Thanks fokr the swift work on getting things to me.
customer_reviews.author: martha mcmurrey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build and quality
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build and quality, great price through Amazon compared to local. Sunday delivery rocked! Just in time for a major canning day. The 22 qt has serious space, makes for faster canning. If you are a canner, this is a great addition to your kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Sly Gray Fox

customer_reviews.title: Lid and gauge 👍
customer_reviews.text: I love the pressure gauge as you can hear it release the steam without having to constantly adjust the heat. It it easier to get pressure adjusted. And the lid is easier to get on and off compared to other canners as I have many canners.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Lea Yoder

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Don't think twice, this is a great deal and a high-quality pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.author: SunRah

customer_reviews.title: I believe it going to be fine for open fire stove
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of the pressure cookier is not flat so when I used it on my electric stove it was heated for 2 hour because of shared area of touching with stove was approximately 2sq ". I'm going to fix it....I'm going to fill the bottom with aluminum by welding. So overall, I believe it going to be fine for open fire stove, but not for electric (which is my case)
customer_reviews.author: Vitzislav P.

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Though not packaged well for shipment, my new Mirro pressure cooker/canner seems to have survived its journey to my home. I won't know if it is working properly until canning season, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Mirro 92116 Polished Aluminum 5 / 10 / 15-PSI Pressure Cooker / Canner Cookware, 16-Quart, Silver
product_meta.description: Size:16-QuartMirro Polished Aluminum Dishwasher Safe 16-Quart Pressure Cooker Canner Cookware, Silver
feature_bullets: The pressure canner is constructed from rustproof heavy-gauge aluminum; holds 16 pint jars or 5 quart jars
Maintains steady pressure with 3 cooking-pressure options--5, 10, and 15 PSI
Reusable overpressure plug, sure-locking lid system, and side gasket pressure release
Cooking rack and user guide with recipes included
Limited 10 years warranty for the pressure canners and limited 1 year warranty for the replacement parts

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars264 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
